heading: Marriage Licences and Ceremonies
text: To get married in Ontario, you first need to apply for a marriage licence. A licence cannot be issued after the wedding ceremony has already happened. These licences are valid for ceremonies held anywhere in Ontario and remain valid for 90 days from the date it was issued.

heading: How to apply for a marriage licence?
text: There is a marriage licence fee of $188 ($94 for eligible residents on the Municipal Fee Assistance Program), and you can pay by cash, money order, Interac, Visa, Mastercard, or American Express. If you have any questions or concerns, please email vitalstatistics@cityofkingston.ca . Apply Now

heading: Civil marriage ceremonies
text: It is important to ensure that your marriage is performed properly and legally. Access a list of who can perform a marriage in Ontario ,Â or call 1-800-461-2156 . To book a civil marriage ceremony, please schedule it at least 14 days in advance. Ceremonies cannot be booked more than 90 days in advance and will not appear on the booking system before that time. If you do not see any dates available, all bookable ceremonies are sold out. After booking, one of our officiants will contact you for a required pre-ceremony consultation. You can choose from three different vows : short and sweet, modern or traditional. The ceremony fee is $350. We accept cash, money orders, Interac, Visa, Mastercard, and American Express. heading: What you need to get married
text: For the ceremony, you will need: If one of you does not speak English, you must arrange and pay for an interpreter. They should complete an interpreter declaration form. However, we offer free American Sign Language interpretation if requested in advance.

heading: What your ceremony will look like
text: Ceremonies happen in Memorial Hall at City Hall and last a maximum of 15 minutes, with an extra 15 minutes for photos and paperwork. Ceremonies follow the Marriage Act. An officiant may refuse to conduct a ceremony if they believe either person is ineligible for a civil marriage ceremony.

heading: Cancellations
text: If you need to cancel a ceremony, a minimum of 48 hours notice is required to receive a refund. There is a $50 administrative fee for cancellations. Unfortunately, no refunds will be issued for cancellations made with less than 48 hours notice.
